theory.introduction: Great code uses functions effectively. This means giving them good names, using comments, and avoiding repetition.
theory.explanation: Keep each function focused on a single task. Use meaningful parameter names. Keep them short and testable. Avoid too many global variables.
keyPoints: Use clear names for functions and parameters
Break large logic into smaller functions
Avoid using too many global variables

codeExamples.code:
def calculate_area(width, height):
    return width * height
